rspec and ruby - part 1

Sep 2 2016

It’s been a while since I posted last, but I’ve been learning quite a bit the past few months.

What I learned today:

  • When using rspec to test whether an exception is raised, the syntax expect( SomeObject.new("zero")).to raise_error(TypeError) ) will not work, while expect { SomeObject.new("zero")}.to raise_error(TypeError) will; note the use of parentheses versus brackets.

  • How to fold in vim

  • about tainting -can’t taint true -can taint an object while setting it to a variable me = “me”.taint; me.tainted? ##> true

  • about threads http://rubylearning.com/satishtalim/ruby_threads.html rb_learning_space taint.rb

  • about rack and make files – Understanding Rack Apps and Middleware

  • yaml, including this answer and this short tutorial
